output.conclusion: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of game theory, equipping students with the analytical tools to model and solve strategic interactions in various domains.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Game Theory! This course delves into the intricacies of strategic decision-making, exploring both classical and modern game-theoretic concepts. We will analyze various game types, solution concepts, and applications across economics, political science, and computer science.

chapters.chapterTitle: Static Games of Complete Information: Nash Equilibrium
chapters.description: Review of Nash Equilibrium: Definition, properties, and examples. Focus on strategic thinking and best-response functions.
Introduction to mixed strategies and their role in Nash Equilibrium. Calculation and interpretation of mixed strategy equilibria.
Real-world applications of Nash Equilibrium in economics, political science, and other fields. Case studies and examples.

chapters.chapterTitle: Dynamic Games of Complete Information: Subgame Perfect Nash Equilibrium
chapters.description: Introduction to dynamic games and the concept of subgame perfect Nash Equilibrium (SPNE).
Explanation of backward induction and its application in finding SPNE. Examples and exercises.
Analysis of repeated games and the conditions for cooperation. Folk Theorem and its implications.

chapters.chapterTitle: Static Games of Incomplete Information: Bayesian Nash Equilibrium
chapters.description: Introduction to games with incomplete information and the concept of Bayesian Nash Equilibrium.
Overview of mechanism design and its applications in auctions, voting, and resource allocation.
Examples of Bayesian games in auctions, signaling, and other contexts. Case studies and analysis.

chapters.chapterTitle: Cooperative Game Theory: Core and Shapley Value
chapters.description: Introduction to cooperative game theory and the concept of the core. Examples and applications.
Explanation of the Shapley value and its properties. Calculation and interpretation of the Shapley value.
Overview of bargaining theory and its applications in negotiations and conflict resolution. Nash bargaining solution.
